intro: Epilinella, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and is typically found in coastal areas. The plant has a succulent stem and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Epilinella is adapted to saline environments, making it a hardy species in coastal regions. It plays an important role in stabilizing sandy shores and supporting local biodiversity.
